3.text:
Hi, I'm Becki and I've decided to take part
in the sixteenth Bout of Books. Something

9.text:
I've taken part in several times. I think
my last one was Bout of Books 15, which was

14.text:
back in January I think? Erm. And it's a lot
of fun to do. It's no pressure. You set your own

21.text:
goals. There's lots of fun stuff to do like
Twitter chat. And there's daily challenges

27.text:
stroke giveaways for you to take part in,
should you wish to. I will leave a link in

32.text:
the description box below if you want to take
part. But beware time is running short because

38.text:
it starts on Monday the ninth of May at one
minute past midnight. And I wish you good

42.text: luck if you decide to take part!

45.text:
So because I've done this before and I've
actually succeeded in doing these goals. I

51.text:
thought I'd go through the same thing again.
So my goals for Bout of Books 16 are to read

58.text:
700 pages. Now this might not sound a lot
to some of you. And it's not really a lot

65.text:
to me on a good week, which thankfully I have
been having recently. But if it's a bad week

71.text:
it can be a real struggle to read 100 pages
a day. And the whole point of Bout of Books

76.text:
is to have fun! And I don't really want to
pile pressure on myself. So I'm going to stick

82.text: with the 100 pages a day or 700 pages total.

88.text:
My other two goals for this challenge are
basically to interact with people more within

97.text:
Bout of Books. So it's not really solitary.
The first is to take part in at least one

103.text:
of the Twitter chats. Now because of the timing
this can be quite hard. Because they're either

109.text:
like really really early or they're at a time
when I would be doing something. So, I will

118.text:
try my hardest to take part in one again this
year because I have enjoyed all the Twitter

123.text:
chats I have taken part in for Bout of Books.
They are mad! And my other goal, which I did

131.text:
really successfully last time, is to attempt
the challenges. And I want to attempt two

138.text:
this time, which - They can be really fun!
Erm. Really quite creative, and I actually

144.text:
quite enjoy that side and it's nice to sort
of break up the reading a bit. So those are

150.text:
And this year I'm doing something a little
different, as you can tell from this vlog.

155.text:
This year instead of recording my results
daily on my blog, what I'm going to try and

161.text:
do is do a little mini-vlog. So that I can
actually, maybe talk a bit more about how

168.text:
my reading's going. See everything in progress
kind of. Do a little mini-chat while I'm reading

175.text:
and stuff. Talk about how the day is going
for me maybe. I will of course also be keeping

181.text: track of stuff like my word count on my blog.

186.text:
Let me know in the comments if you are taking
part because I really enjoy following along

191.text:
with other people. See how they're doing in
the challenges, which is also something I

197.text:
really enjoy about Bout of Books. Thank you
so much for watching. And good luck to everybody

204.text:
And I just want to quickly add, because I
forgot to do this, that the books I'm planning

210.text:
to read are. Erm sort of a bit up in the air
because I've been. Well, reading really well

219.text:
recently. And I've almost completely got through
my TBR pile. Erm. There's a couple of books

226.text:
left and erm there's an ARC for a August publication
date and I don't really want to read that

233.text:
yet even though I have posts scheduled up
to July. Because I think it's a little early

243.text:
to be honest and I'm not that organised. Erm.
Oh and my battery is flickering at me, so

251.text:
Okay. One of the book, erm and it should appear
here, is erm Nina is not Ok by Shappi Khorsandi.

257.text:
It's an ARC I've got, it's an eARC which is
why I've not got a physical copy. And err

266.text:
it's going to be published on the 28th July
so it's something I need to read pretty quickly,

272.text:
and I know it's like May. But I wanna get
ahead so it's not stressful.

277.text:
This book is another. Truth Witch by Susan
Dennard. Er. I got it in the latest Illumicrate.

284.text:
Er, the one coming out in May hasn't been
posted yet so the previous one to that. And

290.text:
I'm really looking forward to reading it,
and this is the prefect excuse to read it.

295.text:
Now that is all the books that I haven't read
before in my TBR. I am planning on ordering

301.text:
some more books, but who knows if they'll
get here in time. And in case I finish those

306.text:
before they do, then there is one more book
I am thinking I might read for the read-a-thon.

311.text:
And it is a re-read. And it has been a while
since I've read it, and it is a completely

316.text:
If I get time, the book I intend to add to
my TBR is this one. I haven't actually had

325.text:
a chance to read it yet. And I'm really looking
forward to it because it looks amazing. It's

330.text:
been a while since I've re-read Harry Potter.
I'm kind of a bit nervous about it because

336.text:
I loved it so much, and it was such a big
part of my life when it was coming out that

342.text:
I'm a bit scared that I'm not going to love
it as much. So I might not actually read it.

347.text: I don't know if I'm brave enough. We'll see.
